intro: Siphonanthus cavus, commonly known as the hollowpipe bush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink and bloom in late spring or early summer. Siphonanthus cavus is often found in chaparral and desert scrub habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
